definition: appetizer/small side dish/easy job/piece of cake/see also 小菜一碟[xiao3 cai4 yi1 die2]
small/tiny/few/young
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor
a small appetizer/a piece of cake; very easy (idiom)
erhua variant of 小菜[xiao3 cai4]
erhua variant of 小菜一碟[xiao3 cai4 yi1 die2]

sentences.english: This consists of a Cable and Apricorn cloning software.
sentences.chinese: 這包括一個小菜一碟電纜和克隆軟件。

sentences.english: Construction and Analysis of the Susceptible Population Life Table of Plutella xylostella L.
sentences.chinese: 小菜蛾敏感種羣生命表的組建與分析。

sentences.english: Speaking good English is a pice of cake.
sentences.chinese: 說一口流利的英語是小菜一碟。

sentences.english: They liked to listen to my intruction about the garden and my little plot.
sentences.chinese: 他們樂於聽我講解我們的花園和我的小菜地。

sentences.english: Objective To explore a new method rearing diamondback moth, Plutella xylostella (L. ).
sentences.chinese: 目的摸索小菜蛾飼養新方法。

sentences.english: It was very easy for him to pour the whole bottle of wine into his throat.
sentences.chinese: 將整瓶酒到進喉嚨對他來說是小菜一碟。

sentences.english: The extracts had evident oviposition deterrence to the adults of Plutella xylostella.
sentences.chinese: 黃荊提取物對小菜蛾成蟲產卵有明顯的忌避作用。

sentences.english: " Preprandial "sending free vegetable, " barbecue and sauerkraut cake tastes good.
sentences.chinese: 餐前“送免費小菜”，烤肉和泡菜餅的味道也不錯。

sentences.english: I'll have a side dish of deep-fried calamari.
sentences.chinese: 我還要一盤小菜油炸卡拉瑪麗。

sentences.english: In fact, Tapas is just some bread with some antipastos.
sentences.chinese: 其實說白了，就是一些麪包，加些小菜。

sentences.english: W2: No, I think learning a foreign language is a piece of cake.
sentences.chinese: 不難，我覺得學一門外語是小菜一碟。

sentences.english: Chop garlic for orange pepper chicken to incorporate into the rice side dish.
sentences.chinese: 印鑑橙色辣椒大蒜雞肉飯納入小菜。

sentences.english: Diamondback moth expressed habituation to and induced preference for non-host originated repellents.
sentences.chinese: 小菜蛾可對驅避素產生習慣性反應和誘導嗜好性。

sentences.english: Though we'll be sure to sample some of that tasty gravy before we're finished.
sentences.chinese: 儘管我們確定要在結束之前嚐嚐一些可口的小菜。

sentences.english: JAF ordered one century egg & lean meat congee and one side dish.
sentences.chinese: 找食趣點了一碗皮蛋瘦肉粥和一樣小菜。

sentences.english: The bowl of rice is accompanied by a variety of dishes prepared by designers all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 圍繞著這碗白飯的，正是設計師們精心炮製的小菜。

definition: dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

vegetable dish
home cooking
vegetable and meat dishes/dish
to be appropriate to have with alcohol/to down one's drink
smashed cucumber salad
seasonal vegetables
non-vegetarian dish (including meat, fish, garlic, onion etc)

hot and sour soup/sour and spicy soup

food and drink/food to accompany wine
